answers.answer: No it wont hurt baby, but you should make it a point to be active throughout the day for your own health.

You don't have to exercise through your pregnancy. Yes its better for you and will help labor but you don't have to do it. And if you rub out of breath easily its probably best you don't do it right now

No it won't hurt and you don't have to do it ...but..just walking short spurts throughout the day will help with the shortness of breath and it also will help keep you healthy and help fight gestational diabetes by having your body burning and breaking down sugars. By no means do you need to do a full on work out but you should walk maybe 3-5 mins here and there throughout the day..I have the same problem with shortness of breath and walking to domy grocery shopping leaves me feeling like i ran a triathlon and exhausted. I walk on and off throughout the day and I'm telling you it will help with your shortness if breath :)
No it wont, and you should talk to your dr if you want to start exercise that you weren't doing prior to pregnancy.

question: Will it hurt the baby to not exercise through the pregnancy.? My husband is constantly working and I'm stuck at home with nothing to do.  I walk around the house but it gets boring after awhile. I also run out of breath really easily.
title: Will it hurt the baby?
